random#

elements#

Random elements and variables with random sampling, statistic generation, and visualization tools.

class stats_learn.random.elements.Base(rng=None)#

Bases: RandomGeneratorMixin, ABC

Base class for random elements.

Parameters:

rng (int or np.random.RandomState or np.random.Generator, optional) – Random number generator seed or object.

property dtype#

Data type of random elements.

Return type:

np.dtype

property mode#

The most probable domain value.

property ndim#

Return type:

int

plot_prob(x=None, ax=None, **kwargs)#

Plot the probability function.

Parameters:

  • x (array_like, optional) – Random element domain values.

  • ax (matplotlib.axes.Axes, optional) – Axes.

  • kwargs (dict, optional) – Additional keyword arguments for self.space.plot method.

Return type:

matplotlib.artist.Artist or tuple of matplotlib.artist.Artist

class stats_learn.random.elements.Beta(a=1.0, b=1.0, rng=None)#

Bases: BaseRV

Beta random variable.

Parameters:

  • a (float, optional) – First concentration parameter.

  • b (float, optional) – Second concentration parameter.

  • rng (int or np.random.RandomState or np.random.Generator, optional) – Random number generator seed or object.

Notes

Defaults to uniform.

property a#

First concentration parameter.

property b#

Second concentration parameter.

classmethod from_mean(mean=0.5, alpha_0=2, rng=None)#

Create Beta RV using mean and total concentration.

Parameters:

  • mean (float, optional) – Mean of the distribution.

  • alpha_0 (float, optional) – Total concentration. Conceptually identical to Dirichlet parameter.

  • rng (int or np.random.RandomState or np.random.Generator, optional) – Random number generator seed or object.

Return type:

Beta

Notes

Defaults to uniform.

class stats_learn.random.elements.DataEmpirical(values, counts, space=None, rng=None)#

Bases: Base

A random element drawn from an empirical distribution.

Parameters:

  • values (array_like) – The values forming the empirical distribution.

  • counts (array_like) – The number of observations for each value.

  • space (spaces.Base, optional) – The domain. Defaults to a Euclidean space.

  • rng (np.random.Generator or int, optional) – Random number generator seed or object.

add_data(d)#

Add data to the empirical distribution.

Parameters:

d (array_like) – New data added to the empirical distribution.

add_values(values, counts)#

Add new values to the empirical distribution.

Parameters:

  • values (array_like) – New values for the empirical distribution.

  • counts (array_like) – The number of observations for each value.

Create random element from a dataset.

Parameters:

  • d (array_like) – The data forming the empirical distribution.

  • space (spaces.Base, optional) – The domain. Defaults to a Euclidean space.

  • rng (np.random.Generator or int, optional) – Random number generator seed or object.

class stats_learn.random.elements.DirichletEmpiricalScalar(mean, alpha_0, n, rng=None)#

Bases: BaseRV

Scalar Dirichlet-Empirical random variable.

Parameters:

  • mean (array_like) –

  • alpha_0 (float) – Localization parameter.

  • n (int) – Number of samples characterizing the realized empirical distributions.

  • rng (int or np.random.RandomState or np.random.Generator, optional) – Random number generator seed or object.

Notes

Equivalent to the first element of a 2-dimensional DirichletEmpirical random variable.

class stats_learn.random.elements.FiniteGeneric(values, p=None, rng=None)#

Bases: Base

Finite-domain random element with specified domain and probabilities.

Parameters:

  • values (array_like) – Explicit domain values.

  • p (array_like, optional) – Probabilities for each value in the domain. Defaults to uniform.

  • rng (int or np.random.RandomState or np.random.Generator, optional) – Random number generator seed or object.

classmethod from_grid(lims, n=100, endpoint=True, p=None, rng=None)#

Create random variable with a finite grid of domain values.

Parameters:

  • lims (array_like) – Lower and upper limits for each dimension.

  • n (int, optional) – Number of points defining the grid.

  • endpoint (bool, optional) – If True, the upper limit values are included in the grid.

  • p (array_like, optional) – Probabilities for each value. Defaults to uniform.

  • rng (int or np.random.RandomState or np.random.Generator, optional) – Random number generator seed or object.

Return type:

FiniteGeneric

property mode#

The most probable domain value.

property p#

Probability mass values.

property values#

Domain values.

class stats_learn.random.elements.NormalLinear(weights=(0.0,), basis=(1.0,), cov=(1.0,), rng=None)#

Bases: Normal

Normal random variable with mean defined in terms of basis tensors.

Parameters:

  • weights (array_like) – Weights defining the mean in terms of the basis tensors.

  • basis (array_like) – Basis tensors, such that mean = basis @ weights.

  • cov (float or numpy.ndarray) – Covariance tensor.

  • rng (np.random.Generator or int, optional) – Random number generator seed or object.

property basis#

Basis tensors, such that mean = basis @ weights.

property weights#

Weights defining the mean in terms of the basis tensors.

models#

Random models of jointly distributed and elements for supervised learning.

class stats_learn.random.models.Base(rng=None)#

Bases: RandomGeneratorMixin, ABC

Base class for random supervised learning models.

Parameters:

rng (int or np.random.RandomState or np.random.Generator, optional) – Random number generator seed or object.

Notes

Implements a joint distribution between an random elements and yrm. For supervised learning, it is assumed that the former is observed while the latter is not.

property dtype#

Data type of random models.

Return type:

dict of np.dtype

class stats_learn.random.models.BetaLinear(weights=(0.0,), basis_y_x=None, alpha_y_x=2.0, model_x=None, rng=None)#

Bases: MixinRVx, MixinRVy, Base

Model characterized by a Beta conditional distribution with mean defined in terms of basis functions.

Parameters:

  • weights (array_like) – The weights combining the basis functions into the conditional mean function.

  • basis_y_x (Collection of callable, optional) – Basis functions. Defaults to polynomial functions.

  • alpha_y_x (float, optional) – Total conditional Beta concentration. Defaults to uniform.

  • model_x (stats_learn.random.elements.Base) – Random variable characterizing the marginal distribution of .

  • rng (int or np.random.RandomState or np.random.Generator, optional) – Random number generator seed or object.

classmethod from_mean_emp(alpha_0, n, func, model_x, rng=None)#

Construct Dirichlet-Empirical conditional random variables from the conditional mean function.

Parameters:

  • alpha_0 (float) – Localization parameter.

  • n (int) – Number of samples characterizing the realized empirical distributions.

  • func (callable) – The conditional mean function.

  • model_x (stats_learn.random.elements.Base) – Random variable characterizing the marginal distribution of .

  • rng (int or np.random.RandomState or np.random.Generator, optional) – Random number generator seed or object.

Return type:

DataConditional

Notes

If alpha_0 is infinite, EmpiricalScalar distributions are generated instead.

classmethod from_mean_poly_emp(alpha_0, n, weights, model_x, rng=None)#

Construct Dirichlet-Empirical conditional random variables with a polynomial conditional mean function.

Parameters:

  • alpha_0 (float) – Localization parameter.

  • n (int) – Number of samples characterizing the realized empirical distributions.

  • weights (array_like) – The weights combining the polynomial functions into the conditional mean function.

  • model_x (stats_learn.random.elements.Base) – Random variable characterizing the marginal distribution of .

  • rng (int or np.random.RandomState or np.random.Generator, optional) – Random number generator seed or object.

Return type:

DataConditional

Plot the covariance of for different values.

Parameters:

  • x (array_like, optional) – Observed random element values. Defaults to self.space.x_plt.

  • ax (matplotlib.axes.Axes, optional) – Axes onto which stats/losses are plotted.

Return type:

matplotlib.artist.Artist or tuple of matplotlib.artist.Artist

class stats_learn.random.models.NormalLinear(weights=(0.0,), basis_y_x=None, cov_y_x=1.0, model_x=None, rng=None)#

Bases: MixinRVx, MixinRVy, Base

Model characterized by a Normal conditional distribution with mean defined in terms of basis functions.

Parameters:

  • weights (array_like) – The weights combining the basis functions into the conditional mean function.

  • basis_y_x (Collection of callable, optional) – Basis functions. Defaults to polynomial functions.

  • cov_y_x (float or callable, optional) – Conditional covariance of Normal distributions.

  • model_x (stats_learn.random.elements.Base) – Random variable characterizing the marginal distribution of .

  • rng (int or np.random.RandomState or np.random.Generator, optional) – Random number generator seed or object.

Basis functions.
